problems.author: Mubarak Aouda
problems.question: What is the SI unit of power?
problems.hint: Power is the rate at which work is done.
problems.detailed: Power measures how quickly work is done or energy is transferred, and its SI unit is the watt (W).

problems.author: Mubarak Aouda
problems.question: A machine does 200 J of work in 5 seconds. What is its power output?

problems.author: Mubarak Aouda
problems.question: Which expression correctly represents power when a constant force moves an object at constant velocity?
problems.hint: Think about how work changes with force and displacement.
problems.detailed: If force and velocity are constant and in the same direction, power can be expressed as P = F × v.

problems.author: Mubarak Aouda
problems.question: A machine has an output power of 300 W and an input power of 500 W. What is its efficiency?

problems.author: Mubarak Aouda
problems.question: Which statement is true for all real machines?
options: Their efficiency is always less than 100 %.
They lose no energy during operation.
They increase total energy in the system.
problems.hint: Real machines always waste some energy.
problems.detailed: Friction and other losses prevent real machines from reaching 100 % efficiency, so their efficiency is always below 100 %.
